headline: Apple-Cranberry Crisp
description: Sweet, juicy apples and fresh, tart cranberries team up in this delightful apple-cranberry crisp topped with oats and pecans. Perfect for the holidays!
name: Apple-Cranberry Crisp
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C.) Butter an 8-inch square baking dish.
Mix apples, cranberries, white sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Place in an even layer in the prepared baking dish.
In the same bowl, combine oats, flour, and brown sugar for topping. Add butter pieces and mix with a fork until crumbly. Stir in pecans. Sprinkle topping over apples in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until apples are tender and topping is golden brown, 40 to 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Loved this! I used less apples and more cranberries, but basically kept the other ratios the same. I like it a little tart so it was perfect.
My family and friends raved about this!!! I had some frozen cranberries and could use them up. With apples in season worked out. The pecans added flavor and crunch. Friends requesting recipe!!
Ha! I just noticed the recipe called for 2 pounds apples, not 2 like I did but it still was very good. Just a bit too much cinnamon for me (or maybe not enough apples)
Loved it except for the pecans. Next time, I'll leave those out.

Delicious!! I had extra crans I needed to use up, so I roughly doubled the cranberries and halved the amount of apples used. 
I would recommend putting in a little less cinnamon (esp if using fewer apples).
Love, Love, Love!
I liked the flavor of the sweet apples and tart cranberries. The crisp was too dry for my taste. I doubled the butter so it was crispy without being sandy dry.
Just used a little less sugar for the crumb topping. I used dried cranberries which worked well. Delicious!!!
Wonderful! This will be my go-to for crisps from now on!
It was delicious! I'll make it again.
I really enjoyed this even though I thought it had a bit too much cinnamon. Next time I will use a bit less.

My husband, mother-in-law and I loved this recipe. I made it pretty much as described except for using a non-dairy butter and spraying the baking dish with cooking spray instead of using butter. Served with vanilla ice cream. Absolutely delicious!
I added Lipton onion soup mix to the broth and included some cauliflower and celery because I had it on hand. Added a splash of white wine. Very good!!!!

I amended this recipe a bit, per a few other reviews. I doubled the cranberries, (added the perfect amount of tartness) but still used 4 large Granny Smith apples. I doubled the crisp topping and, added about about two table spoons extra butter. I made this as one of our Thanksgiving desserts. It turned out amazing!!! It was the first to be devoured. My husband, and teenage boys ate it all the same day! ?(^?^)?

Really good! Reviews say it has too much cinnamon, but i think it's delicious! 4 stars because, as most recipes are, it needs slight changes because it's not completely perfect. I do think it's great for holidays with a bunch of people. I'm only 12 years old and I was able to make this and have everyone adore it! I think that's an accomplishment. Thanks to the creator for such a wonderful recipe.

Excellent, but note that I did make a few changes mostly based on what I had on hand. I used a combination of honeycrisp and Jonathan apples and walnuts instead of pecans. Because I love cranberries I doubled (at least!) the number of cranberries and so increased the sugar inside the crisp by about a tablespoon or so. I was out of nutmeg and didn’t miss it, but I’m guessing it would be great with it.
Great holiday flavored dessert! I followed suggestions and doubled the topping and cranberries, it was great!

Hubby gave this dessert 5 stars! It is great as it stands or it is easy to modify depending on what ingredients you have on hand. I made a 9x13 pan full, increasing the recipe accordingly. Since I only had 5 large Granny Smith's, I added a can of unsweetened apple pie filling. Then realizing I was out of pecans, I substituted sliced almonds. It was delicious warm with ice cream! It is hard to mess this recipe up. Great fruit combination!
I made this as is, and it is excellent! I found it a tad sweet, so next time I may cut back on the white sugar.

This was amazing!!! I had gala apples not Granny Smith but I used a full cup of cranberries. I actually was craving rhubarb crisp but it's not exactly rhubarb season here in Alberta. I made this for dessert after easter dinner and wow. I will definitely make this again! I made no changes to the recipe as others did, (other than the different type of apple) and the spices and flavours were perfectly balanced, I wouldn't change a thing! Thank you for sharing.
The cranberries make this dessert pop! Loved it.
MMMMM......... tart and delicious with some ice cream or whipped cream!! A keeper for sure!
This was so delicious! I would change nothing!

I used Haralson Apples(crisp & tart) that being the only change I made. Next time however, I will cut back the cinnamon as I thought it was a bit too much. Otherwise, my very picky self and family loved it.

The cranberry apple crisp was a hit at Thanksgiving. I had left my recipe at home so I found this one to use. I remembered from my recipe to put pats of butter on top vs mixing with topping. That works well. I think the other way would be too dry.

It was literally ok. A soggier crisp than I'm used to. After reading the reviews I kept all the same but increased the cranberries to 1 cup. Not too tart. Ate it cool. Will try the leftover hot. Maybe a day later it's better.
Next time I will half the cinnamon... it was a bit much.

This is terrific! I utilized the recipe exactly, and only added a splash of King Arthur boiled cider in the mixture. I also sprinkled the pecans on top of the topping, instead of mixing them in, so they were toasty and tasty. Thanks for an easy and great recipe!
made this twice. once w/ blueberries . once added sliced pears.Liked both.

I tried this with a mixture of apples and pears instead of cranberries, since it's not cranberry season right now. I also omitted the nutmeg. This was delicious! It has became a regular when having friends over for coffee.
This is delicious! Followed the recipe and will definitely make this again! I especially like that I didn't have to make a 9X13" sized dessert for just my husband & I.

I've made this several times for family/friends gatherings and it turns out terrific every single time and always gets tons of compliments. I love it because it is SO easy to make. I too make extra topping and if I accidentally make too much, I just throw it in a freezer bag to use on the next one or on another dessert some other time. The only thing I change with this recipe is the serving size! Perfect "as is" in my opinion =)

Excellent recipe. Made it pretty much as written 
but used a 9-inch round pan. Served warm with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. Bliss!

This was great! I believe in using the original recipe first run, but was forced to make two changes on the topping that did work due to ingredients on hand. I had regular oats on hand and not quick cooking ones. I used 1/2 pecans and 1/2 sliced almonds. Both were perfectly fine as a substitute. I followed everything else as written and believe a little less cinnamon would be more preferred by me. It was great with vanilla ice-cream and a wonderful tart treat! This recipe is a keeper and will make again.

Followed the recipe exactly and I was completely underwhelmed by this recipe (as was the rest of the family). It just didn't turn out for some reason. It was watery and unappetizing. No one even ate the leftovers. Will not make this again.
I tripled the crumb part based on other reviews. Who doesn't love more crumb? It was delicious!!!!! Quite the hit at my dinner party. Definitely will use again.
This was just a little tart. But still very good. Made just as written. Will make this again. No one complained. Maybe add some ice cream next time.

This was delicious. I made a double batch in a 9 by 13 glass dish. The apples and the cranberries with the cinnamon and nutmeg all mixed together and gooey under that nice crisp crust... AMAZING!! It was definitely a big hit. I also made a regular batch using 1/2 cup raisins instead of cranberries. Equally as good for those who do not care for cranberries.

Everything worked out as described, following recipe as written. I will modify it in just one way next time and that is to reduce the cinnamon. I use saigon cinnamon it was just too spicy and not as pleasant texture wise if it had less. I could probably use just half the amount and it would be plenty strong.
Awesome. I used glutenfree ingredients. Yummy.

Used half white and half brown sugar, a bit more cranberries than called for, some cut in half and the rest whole, plus doubled the topping. Also doubled the entire recipe and made this in 10" x 13" pan, and it turned out phenomenally.
We love this dessert however in order to cover the entire dessert we have to double the oat topping. I also add a bit of orange zest and fresh squeezed orange juice to the apple mixture
I put the filling into small pastry cups and made tarts out of it and they were awesome!!! Topped with a scoop of French vanilla ice cream and it was the first dessert gone!!
This is a great recipe especially for those who enjoy the tanggy taste of cranberries. For those who do not increase the sugar to 1/2 cup.
Way too much cinnamon for my family. However it was gone in 12 hours. I doubled the topping. I am making it again with 1/2 the cinnamon it calls for. May be 5 stars later.
Easy and delicious!

this recipe is pretty great. I made it for our family Christmas celebrations, I substituted butter for oil. the only thing I would do differently next time is add less cranberries, although my husband disagrees

This turned out fabulously! Giving 4 stars because I put in more cranberries than were called for and I think it needed them. I made a double recipe and put in about 2 1/2 cups of cranberries; it wasn't too tart at all and it made the cranberries more than just an accent.
Loved it! The combination of apples and cranberries is great. Much better than making plain old apple crisp ;) Thank you!

Made this at Thanksgiving and it was good, not great. Keep in mind that the cranberries make it pretty tart so this is not a sweet dessert. I created more of the topping as others suggested but it didn't seem to bake completely. Was still good with whip cream on top but not a favorite.

I LOVE this. I was hesitant that the combination of granny smith and cranberries would be too tart, but the cinnamon and sugar balanced it out perfectly. I doubled the crisp topping. I made this for a Christmas Eve party at my aunt's house, and my husband dug into it while it was sitting on his lap in the car.
I LOVE apple crisp, but wanted to try something a little bit different. What could be more holiday-ish than adding cranberries? This filled the bill, but wasn't better than straight apples.
to much cinn...not sweet enough.

This is fantastic! My husband, who does not like sweets and never eats dessert, was persuaded to try a bite. He ended up eating 2 large pieces! I followed the directions as written and it was perfect.

This is the best recipe! I made 2 batches of it last Thanksgiving, and I hardly got any. Everything is perfect about this: tartness, sweetness, a little crunchy, very soft inside. It's best when warm!

I doubled the topping, used 2/3 of the amount of cinnamon, increased cranberries to a full cup, added 1/4 cup flour and 1/2 cup apple cider to apple cranberry mix. And used fugi apples . And it was amazing!!!!!!!
This was so good! Everybody loved it. I did cut down on the sugar.
This was amazing! Quick fast and very easy!
This is a great basic recipe, but there was way too much nutmeg in it. That was the dominate flavor in this recipe. Next time, I'll only use 1/2 a teaspoon of nutmeg.

This is one of the most delicious recipes I have ever made and has become a part of my permanent family cookbook. Since it was summer when I made this, I was unable to find cranberries fresh or frozen. So, instead I made it as an entirely apple crisp. It was fabulous. Would be good served warm with a scoop of ice cream! Going to roll this out for company on Thanksgiving and add the cranberries. Don't read any further...you are guaranteed to love it!
I prepared the recipe as is. It's okay. There is too much cinnamon in the fruit portion. It overpowers the taste of the fruit. The crisp is very good.
This was really yummy! I made it for a Thanksgiving dessert, and it was lovely--very fall-appropriate, not TOO sweet, and wonderful flavor.

I made this with some tart apples, I used less sugar for fruit and topping. Used agave and stevia to cut down on sugar. Did not use pecans or regular flour because of food allergies. Instead I ground gluten free oats to make oat flour. Next time I will use only 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg. I also leave the apple peels on....we like it that way and it saves time on making it too. It was delicious!
A little strong for us. I will make again with less cinnamon and nutmeg.
Great refreshing dessert after a big holiday meal. I used walnuts and topped with can cream. It is good hot or cold.

Absolutely the best!!!!
I used 4 large granny smiths, which is comparable to 2 lbs
I used dried cranberries, as I wasn't sure if recipe was for fresh or not.
this was a very very very good and if you want to make a dessert to please, this is it.
I made no changes to this recipe except i did double the topping mixture as other reviewers suggested, and it was perfect!!!
Made this for Thanksgiving, turned out great!!
YUM! This is even more perfect with ice cream. It was a huge hit. I made mine with a Stevia sugar substitute with great results.
Best crisp I ever had! Followed recipe exactly & it was the perfect amount of fruit & crisp! Whole family loved it...it was completely gone in 10 minutes!

I enjoyed this crisp, the filling was delicious. I did use a mixture of raspberries, blackberries, and blueberries because I could not find cranberries :( However, the crisp I feel like I wanted it more crispy, something was missing but I am not sure what it was.
This was really delicious! I had to use a 9x13 pan to hold all of the apples. Because of the larger surface area I doubled the crumb topping. Other than that I followed the recipe exactly.

For the crispiest topping you have to add a little water; 1-2 tablespoons. This was a good recipe I doubled the topping, cranberries and used a 9x13 pan. Next time I would use a sweeter apple, the Granny Smith with the cranberries were too tart. The addition of vanilla ice cream really helped the tartness!
This is an absolutely amazing dish. I made it for my family, and they all loved it. The only thing i did differently was I doubled the topping. It was sooooo good!

I just made this and it was wonderful!! I reduced the cinnamon by 1/2 tsp I couldn't find any fresh or frozen cranberries so I used dried cranberries. I alsodoubled the topping and put it all in a larger baking dish. I will definately make this again!
So yummy. I bake this in individual ramekins. My husband likes this so much that he will actually go in the kitchen and make this on his own -=gasp=-

I have made this several times and always receive rave comments. I use an apple peeler so the slices are thin. I bake it at 40 minutes - I once baked it for 50 minutes and the apples were mushy/overdone.
Serve it warm with vanilla ice cream.
PERFECT--if you like cranberries. Not to sweet. It took longer to peel and slice apples than anything else--quite easy to make. It did not last too long-it was good!!
This was wonderful! I didn't have enough apples, so I used a couple of pears, and it turned out great. I served it warm with vanilla ice cream. YUM!

This was a fantastic treat during a wisconsin winter blizzard. I doubled the entire recipe and baked in a 9x11 1/2 pan. I used 1/2 granny smith apples and 1/2 fuji. I also used craisins instead of fresh cranberries. I used the full amount of cinnamon and didn't regret it. While still warm I drizzled some caramel over the topping. (Didn't regret that AT ALL! LOL) Great warm or cold.

While there aren't very many cranberries in this recipe, they give the sauce a pretty rosy color. I followed the recipe as written, but really feel this has too much cinnamon, and it needs a larger pan (a 9" square would be about right). We needed to serve this with whipped cream to tone down the cinnamon a little.
Very good but a little too tart! I halved the amount of cinnamon because I thought it was a little too much, just a preference. I would definitely reduce the amount of cranberries next time!
It was wonderful! I skipped the pecans.
Perfect fall crisp. Loved the tart cranberry addition with the apples. Definitely a favorite.

Delicious! Won me so many compliments :) I used this as an addition to Thanksgiving pies this year by just sticking it in a graham cracker crust instead of a 9x9" dish. Omitted pecans, made about 1 1/2 times the topping which was plenty. Used 4 apples(2 lbs) and 1 1/2 C cranberries. Also seasoned w/1 t mace, 1 t cinnamon, & 2 t fresh allspice = amazing! I think next time I'll be using 3 apples & 2 C cranberries. My host topped it with fresh whipped cream and it was perfect.

A-ma-zing, I loved this. I made it for Thanksgiving (tomorrow) but when I tried it tonight I HAD to have a bowl. I did mess up and put the brown sugar into the fruit part, but that just made it better. I also tripled the topping and I'm glad I did. I used craisins, too, instead of regular cranberries.
Delicious and easy! I doubled the cranberries and added a little extra topping. Made without nuts due to allergies, and it was divine with vanilla ice cream. Thanks so much!!
This recipe was easy to make and since most of my family cannot have gluten, I replaced the 1/3cp of oatmeal with 1/3 cup of Gluten-free baking mix. The dish was delicious!
Love it! Used all spice instead of nutmeg.
Followed the directions, and it turned out dry, even after adding some apple juice halfway through cooking.

Amazing recipe and super easy! I cut down the cinnamon and nutmeg just a little bit and add a bit more pecans to the crumble for an extra crunch. My whole family loves it and beg me make it all the time.

Okay, so I ended up reading this recipe wrong. I didn't realize that the topping was supposed to go on last (on top) i thought it said to mix everything together.....which i did. And then i realized the crumb topping went on top. So i had the topping mixed in, then made another batch of crisp to go on top. Turned out AMAZING! I will definitely make this again!! Everyone loved it! And it turned out very well with the topping mixed in and on top!
This was INCREDIBLE! I just didn't have any pecans, but it was still absolutely delicious! My 3 year old son loved it so much, he licked the bowl clean!

I like the combination of apples and cranberries. I increased the cranberries to a full cup and increased the topping by fifty percent. I had to use a larger pan because it did not fit in my eight inch square pan. I received several compliments on the dessert. Good stuff!
A hit at Thanksgiving.

I halved the recipe and cooked it in a glass loaf pan. I omitted the pecans and added a few extra cranberries. I will definitely make it again-- the fruit is tangy and delicious, and the topping is perfect. Next time I might omit the white sugar and replace half or all of the Granny Smiths with Golden Delicious to increase the natural sweetness.

Great, got rave reviews, I did add more cranberries.. The second time I made it I doubled the amount of apples/cranberries and tripled the topping because it was such a hit..everyone asked for recipe!

I read the reviews first and added more cranberries. I enjoyed it very much. If you want a tart crisp this is definitely that. If you want a sweeter crisp I would recommend using a sweeter apple and use the recipe's amount of cranberries. I served it with vanilla ice cream and the combination of tart and sweetness was really nice.
EXCELLENT!! Definitely a keeper!
This is fabulous! I used more cranberries, and less cinnamon and sugar. Also doubled the topping. I used melted butter in the topping and it turned out great.
